member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.AccessControlManager
member.summary: Access control manager. Dictates which connections are permitted or denied.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.AccessControlManager.Mode
member.summary: Access control mode, either DefaultPermit or DefaultDeny. DefaultPermit: allow everything, except for those explicitly denied. DefaultDeny: deny everything, except for those explicitly permitted.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.AccessControlManager.Permit(System.String)
member.summary: Permit or deny a request based on IP address. When operating in 'default deny', only specified entries are permitted. When operating in 'default permit', everything is allowed unless explicitly denied.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Core.AccessControlMode.DefaultPermit
member.summary: Permit requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Core.AccessControlMode.DefaultDeny
member.summary: Deny requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.Chunk
member.summary: A chunk of data, used when reading from a request where the Transfer-Encoding header includes 'chunked'.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.Chunk.Metadata
member.summary: Any additional metadata that appears on the length line after the length hex value and semicolon.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.Chunk.IsFinal
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this is the final chunk, i.e. the chunk length received was zero.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRoute.IsDirectory
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRoute.ExceptionHandler
member.summary: The handler to invoke when exceptions are raised.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRoute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpContextBase,System.Exception,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Guid,System.Object)
member.param: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.
The method that should be called to handle exceptions.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager
member.summary: Content route manager. Content routes are used for GET and HEAD requests to specific files or entire directories.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Base directory for files and directories accessible via content routes.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.ContentFileMode
member.summary: The FileMode value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileMode.Open.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.ContentFileAccess
member.summary: The FileAccess value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileAccess.Read.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.ContentFileShare
member.summary: The FileShare value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileShare.Read.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.DefaultFiles
member.summary: Default filenames on which to search when provided a root URL, e.g. /.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.Add(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpContextBase,System.Exception,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Guid,System.Object)
member.param: True if the path represents a directory.
The method that should be called to handle exceptions.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.Get(System.String)
member.returns: ContentRoute if the route exists, otherwise null.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.ContentRouteManager.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path regex.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRoute.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRoute.Handler
member.summary: The handler for the dynamic route.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRoute.ExceptionHandler
member.summary: The handler to invoke when exceptions are raised.

member.param: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.
The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
The method that should be called to handle the request.
The method that should be called to handle exceptions.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRouteManager
member.summary: Dynamic route manager. Dynamic routes are used for requests using any HTTP method to any path that can be matched by regular expression.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRouteManager.Matcher
member.summary: Directly access the underlying regular expression matching library. This is helpful in case you want to specify the matching behavior should multiple matches exist.

member.param: The method that should be called to handle exceptions.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.DynamicRouteManager.Exists(WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpMethod,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.summary: Match a request method and URL to a handler method.

member.summary: UTC timestamp from when the context object was created.

member.summary: The HTTP request that was received.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpContextBase.Response
member.summary: The HTTP response that will be sent. This object is preconstructed on your behalf and can be modified directly.

member.summary: HTTP methods, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.ThreadId
member.summary: Thread ID on which the request exists.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method used in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.MethodRaw
member.summary: The string version of the HTTP method, useful if Method is UNKNOWN.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Headers
member.summary: The headers found in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Keepalive
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the client requested HTTP keepalives.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.ChunkedTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding was detected.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Gzip
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been gzip compressed.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Deflate
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been deflate compressed.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Useragent
member.summary: The useragent specified in the request.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.ContentType
member.summary: The content type as specified by the requestor (client).

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.ContentLength
member.summary: The number of bytes in the request body.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.Data
member.summary: The stream from which to read the request body sent by the requestor (client).

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.DataAsBytes
member.summary: Retrieve the request body as a byte array. This will fully read the stream.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpRequestBase.DataAsString
member.summary: Retrieve the request body as a string. This will fully read the stream.

member.summary: For chunked transfer-encoded requests, read the next chunk. It is strongly recommended that you use the ChunkedTransfer parameter before invoking this method.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.summary: IP address to which the request was made.

member.summary: TCP port on which the request was received.

member.summary: Retrieve the response body sent using a Send() or SendAsync() method.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.Send(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.Send(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers with a specified content length and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection. Useful for HEAD requests where the content length must be set.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.Send(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.Send(System.Int64,System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.SendChunk(System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers (if not already sent) and a chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding, and keep the connection in-tact.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpResponseBase.SendFinalChunk(System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send headers (if not already sent) and the final chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding and terminate the connection.
member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the request.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.ParameterRouteManager
member.summary: Parameter route manager. Parameter routes are used for requests using any HTTP method to any path where parameters are defined in the URL. For example, /{version}/api. For a matching URL, the HttpRequest.Url.Parameters will contain a key called 'version' with the value found in the URL.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.ParameterRouteManager.Matcher
member.summary: Directly access the underlying URL matching library. This is helpful in case you want to specify the matching behavior should multiple matches exist.

member.param: The method that should be called to handle exceptions.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverBase.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpContextBase,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the webserver. If you do not provide a settings object, default settings will be used, which will cause the webserver to listen on http://127.0.0.1:8000, and send events to the console.
member.param: Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverBase.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.Core.HttpContextBase,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson webserver.
member.param: Hostname or IP address on which to listen.
TCP port on which to listen.
Specify whether or not SSL should be used (HTTPS).
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.param: Cancellation token useful for canceling the server.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents

member.summary: Method to use for sending log messages.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Event to fire when a connection is received.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ConnectionDenied
member.summary: Event to fire when a connection is denied. This event is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.RequestReceived
member.summary: Event to fire when a request is received.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.RequestDenied

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ExceptionEncountered
member.summary: Event to fire when an exception is encountered.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ServerStarted
member.summary: Event to fire when the server is started.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ServerStopped
member.summary: Event to fire when the server is stopped.

member.name: E:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverEvents.ServerDisposing

member.summary: Buffer size to use when interacting with streams.

member.summary: Read timeout, in milliseconds. This property is only used by WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.IOSettings.MaxIncomingHeadersSize
member.summary: Maximum incoming header size, in bytes. This property is only used by WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.IOSettings.EnableKeepAlive
member.summary: Flag indicating whether or not the server requests a persistent connection.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.SslSettings.SslCertificate
member.summary: Certifcate for SSL. For WatsonWebserver, install the certificate in your operating system. This property is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.SslSettings.PfxCertificateFile
member.summary: PFX certificate filename. For WatsonWebserver, install the certificate in your operating system. This property is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.SslSettings.PfxCertificatePassword
member.summary: PFX certificate password. For WatsonWebserver, install the certificate in your operating system. This property is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.SslSettings.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Require mutual authentication. This property is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.SslSettings.AcceptInvalidAcertificates
member.summary: Accept invalid certificates including self-signed and those that are unable to be verified. This property is not used by WatsonWebserver, only WatsonWebserver.Lite.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Core.WebserverSettings.HeaderSettings.IncludeContentLength
member.summary: Automatically set content length if not already set.
